00016 #define TRUE     1
00017 #define FALSE    0
00018 #define PI       3.141592654
00019 #define EPSILON  0.01
00020 #define LIMIT    10000
00021 
00022 #include "stdio.h"
00023 #include "stdlib.h"
00024 #include "string.h"
00025 #include "math.h"
00026 #include "utility.h"
00027 
00028 
00029 #define SVD_RELATIVE_THRESHOLD 1.0e-2
00030 #define SVD_THRESHOLD 0.01
00031 
00032 #define SVD            0
00033 #define LUDCMP         1
00034 #define INVERSE_METHOD LUDCMP
00035 
00036 #define NORMAL_ITERATION 1
00037 #define EIGEN_METHOD     2  
00038 #define HEWER_METHOD     3
00039 #define DLQR_METHOD      NORMAL_ITERATION
00040 
00041 /*!*****************************************************************************
00042  *******************************************************************************
00043 \note  dlqr
00044 \date  Oct. 25, 1992
00045 
00046 \remarks 
00047 
00048       calculates the K matrix of a discrete LQR controller
00049 
00050  *******************************************************************************
00051  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00052 
00053  \param[in]     fx         : A matrix of model x(n+1) = fx*x(n) + fu*u(n)
00054  \param[in]     fu         : B matrix of model 
00055  \param[in]     lxx        : weight matrix for x
00056  \param[in]     luu        : weight matrix for u
00057  \param[out]    d          : u(n) = -d * x(n)
00058  \param[in]     n_states   : number of states
00059  \param[in]     n_controls : number of controls
00060  \param[in,out] p           : the initial value function matrix
00061 
00062    note: q must be positive definite and r must be positive semi-definite
00063          matrices must start with index 1 (like numerical recipes)
00064 
00065    return  : TRUE or FALSE, i.e., calcuation successful or not
00066 
00067  ******************************************************************************/
00068 int
00069 dlqr(double **fx, double **fu, double **lxx, double **luu, double **d, 
00070      int n_states, int n_controls, double **p)
00071 
00072 {
00073 
00074   double difference=99999;
00075   int i,j,m,n;
00076   int firsttime=TRUE;
00077   double info;
00078   static double **zxx,**zux,**zxu,**zuu,
00079   **fxt,**fut,**t1,**t2,**t3, **t4,**p_new, **zuu_inv;
00080   static double **diff;
00081   static int    *indx;
00082   int rc=FALSE;
00083   int count;
00084   double wmax, wmin;  
00085   static double **v, *w;
00086   static double **h;
00087   static double **luu_inv;
00088   static double **fx_invt;
00089   
00090   /* for Hewer's algorithm */
00091 
00092   static double **s;
00093   static double **wn;
00094   static double **vn;
00095   static double **phi;
00096   static double **eye;
00097   static double **f,**e,**ft;
00098   static int last_n_states = 0, last_n_controls = 0;
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102   /* I used the algorithm as outlined by Dyer and McReynolds 1970 */
00103   /* the entire algorithm is a multistage optimization problem in
00104      which the k matrix finally converges to a constant matrix. 
00105      It is not quite clear how long this actually takes. Thus I 
00106      stop the program after convergence or a certain LIMIT of
00107      iterations. */
00108 
00109 
00110 
00111   /* some temporary matrices */
00112 
00113   if (last_n_states != n_states || last_n_controls != n_controls) {
00114 
00115     if (last_n_states > 0) {
00116       my_free_matrix(zxx,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00117       my_free_matrix(zux,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_states);
00118       my_free_matrix(zxu,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_controls);
00119       my_free_matrix(zuu,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_controls);
00120       my_free_matrix(p_new,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00121       my_free_matrix(fxt,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00122       my_free_matrix(fut,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_states);
00123       my_free_matrix(t1,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00124       my_free_matrix(t2,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_states);
00125       my_free_matrix(t3,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_controls);
00126       my_free_matrix(t4,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00127       my_free_ivector(indx,1, last_n_controls);
00128       my_free_matrix(zuu_inv,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_controls);
00129       my_free_matrix(diff,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00130       my_free_matrix(v,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_controls);
00131       my_free_vector(w,1,last_n_controls);
00132       my_free_matrix(h,1,last_n_states+last_n_states,1,last_n_states+last_n_states);
00133       my_free_matrix(luu_inv,1,last_n_controls,1,last_n_controls);
00134       my_free_matrix(fx_invt,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00135       my_free_matrix(s,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00136       my_free_matrix(wn,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00137       my_free_matrix(vn,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00138       my_free_matrix(phi,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00139       my_free_matrix(eye,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00140       my_free_matrix(f,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00141       my_free_matrix(e,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00142       my_free_matrix(ft,1,last_n_states,1,last_n_states);
00143     }
00144     
00145     zxx     = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00146     zux     = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_states);
00147     zxu     = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_controls);
00148     zuu     = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_controls);
00149     p_new   = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00150     fxt     = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00151     fut     = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_states);
00152     t1      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00153     t2      = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_states);
00154     t3      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_controls);
00155     t4      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00156     indx    = my_ivector(1, n_controls);
00157     zuu_inv = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_controls);
00158     diff    = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00159     v       = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_controls);
00160     w       = my_vector(1,n_controls);
00161     h       = my_matrix(1,n_states+n_states,1,n_states+n_states);
00162     luu_inv = my_matrix(1,n_controls,1,n_controls);
00163     fx_invt = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00164     s       = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00165     wn      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00166     vn      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00167     phi     = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00168     eye     = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00169     f       = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00170     e       = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00171     ft      = my_matrix(1,n_states,1,n_states);
00172 
00173   }
00174 
00175   last_n_states = n_states;
00176   last_n_controls = n_controls;
00177 
00178 
00179   mat_trans(fx,fxt);
00180   mat_trans(fu,fut);
00181 
00182   mat_zero(p);
00183   
00184   /* the identity matrix as n_states x n_states */
00185 
00186   for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00187     for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00188       eye[i][j] = 0.0;
00189       if (i==j) eye[i][j] = 1.0;
00190     }
00191   }
00192 
00193   count = 0;
00194   
00195   while (difference > EPSILON && count < LIMIT) {
00196 
00197     ++count;
00198     
00199     switch (DLQR_METHOD) {
00200 
00201 
00202     case NORMAL_ITERATION:
00203       
00204       mat_mult(fxt, p, t1);
00205       mat_mult(t1, fx, zxx);
00206       mat_add(lxx, zxx, zxx);
00207       
00208       mat_mult(t1, fu, zxu);
00209       
00210       mat_mult(fut, p, t2);
00211       mat_mult(t2, fu, zuu);
00212       mat_add(luu, zuu, zuu);
00213       
00214       mat_mult(t2, fx, zux);
00215       
00216 
00217       /* finally, I have to invert zuu */
00218       
00219       if (INVERSE_METHOD == LUDCMP) {
00220         
00221         /*      for (i=1; i<=n_controls; ++i) {
00222                 for (j=1; j<=n_controls; ++j) {
00223                 printf("  %f ",zuu[i][j]);
00224                 }
00225                 printf("\n");
00226                 }
00227                 */
00228         if (!my_inv_ludcmp(zuu,  n_controls,  zuu_inv)) {
00229           
00230           /*            printf("count = %d\n",count);
00231                         
00232                         for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00233                         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00234                         printf("%f ",fx[i][j]);
00235                         }
00236                         printf("\n");
00237                         }
00238                         for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00239                         for (j=1; j<=n_controls; ++j) {
00240                         printf("%f ",fu[i][j]);
00241                         }
00242                         printf("\n");
00243                         }
00244                         for (i=1; i<=n_controls; ++i) {
00245                         for (j=1; j<=n_controls; ++j) {
00246                         printf("%f ",zuu[i][j]);
00247                         }
00248                         printf("\n");
00249                         }
00250                         */      
00251           printf("LUDCMP choked!!\n");
00252           return FALSE;
00253         }
00254         
00255         
00256       } else if (INVERSE_METHOD == SVD) {
00257         
00258         /* make zuu_inv the identity matrix */
00259         
00260         for (i=1; i<=n_controls; ++i) {
00261           for (j=1; j<=n_controls; ++j) {
00262             zuu_inv[i][j] = 0.0;
00263             if (i==j) zuu_inv[i][j] = 1.0;
00264           }
00265         }
00266         
00267         /* do an svd of zuu */
00268         
00269         my_svdcmp( zuu, n_controls, n_controls, w, v );
00270         
00271         /* Choose threshold singular value. */
00272         
00273         wmax = 0.0;
00274         for( j = 1; j <= n_controls; j++ ) if( w[j] > wmax )  wmax = w[j];
00275         wmin = wmax * SVD_RELATIVE_THRESHOLD;
00276         if ( wmin > SVD_THRESHOLD ) wmin = SVD_THRESHOLD;
00277         
00278         /* Zero singular values < wmin */
00279         
00280         for( j = 1; j <= n_controls; j++ ) {
00281           if ( w[j] < wmin ) {
00282             w[j] = 0.0;
00283           }
00284         }
00285         
00286         /* now generate the inverse. Due to the setup of matrices, I will
00287            actuall create the transpose of the inverse */
00288         
00289         for (i=1; i<=n_controls; ++i) {
00290           my_svbksb( zuu, w, v, n_controls, n_controls, zuu_inv[i], zuu_inv[i] );
00291         }
00292         
00293         
00294         /* now take the transpose of this inverse to make it what I want */
00295         
00296         mat_trans(zuu_inv, zuu_inv);
00297         
00298         
00299       } 
00300 
00301       /* finally calculate the update of p */
00302       
00303       mat_mult(zuu_inv, zux, t2);
00304       mat_mult(zxu, t2, p_new);
00305       mat_sub(zxx, p_new, p_new);
00306       
00307       mat_sub(p_new, p,  diff);
00308       
00309       mat_equal(p_new, p);
00310       
00311       difference = 0;
00312       for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00313         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00314           difference += fabs(diff[i][j]);
00315         }
00316       }
00317       
00318       
00319       /* now check the result of this show */
00320       /* NOTE: I calculate the control matrix also at the last step of
00321          the iterations in case it is to be used even if the convergence
00322          was not satistfying */
00323       
00324       if (difference < EPSILON || count == LIMIT) {
00325         
00326         /* this calculates the k-matrix */
00327         
00328         mat_mult(zuu_inv, zux, d);
00329         
00330         if (difference < EPSILON) rc = TRUE;
00331         
00332       } else {
00333         
00334         rc = FALSE;
00335         
00336       }
00337       
00338 /*      
00339       printf("return code=%d difference=%f\n",rc,difference);
00340       for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00341         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00342           printf("%f ",d[i][j]);
00343         }
00344         printf("\n");
00345       }
00346 */      
00347 
00348       break;
00349 
00350 
00351     case HEWER_METHOD:
00352 
00353       /* this method I found in the 1974 paper of Kleinman */
00354 
00355 
00356       if (firsttime) {
00357 
00358         /* the extension which Kleinman contributed to Hewer's and other people's
00359            algorithms is that he computes an initial matrix for the iterations
00360            which guarantees to make the iteration stable */
00361 
00362         firsttime = FALSE;
00363 
00364         if (!my_inv_ludcmp(luu, n_controls, luu_inv)) {
00365           
00366           printf("weight matrix luu is singular\n");
00367           return FALSE;
00368           
00369         }
00370         mat_mult(fu,luu_inv,t3);
00371         mat_mult(t3,fut,s);
00372 
00373         /* some efficient computational tricks are involved here */
00374 
00375         n = (int)(log((double)n_states)/log(2.0)+.9999999);
00376         mat_equal(s,e);
00377         mat_equal(fx,f);
00378         mat_trans(f,ft);
00379 
00380 
00381         for (i=1; i<=n; ++i) {
00382 
00383           mat_mult(ft,e,t1);
00384           mat_mult(t1,f,t1);
00385           mat_add(e,t1,e);
00386           mat_mult(f,f,f);
00387           mat_trans(f,ft);
00388 
00389         }
00390 
00391 
00392         if (!my_inv_ludcmp(e, n_states, t1)) {
00393           
00394           printf("special matrix >e< for Hewer initialization is singular\n");
00395           return FALSE;
00396           
00397         }       
00398         mat_mult(ft,t1,vn);
00399         mat_mult(vn,f,vn);
00400 
00401         /* vn is the crucial inital matrix for me to get started */
00402 
00403       } 
00404 /*
00405       printf("vn-matrix:\n");
00406       for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00407         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00408           printf("%f ",vn[i][j]);
00409         }
00410         printf("\n");
00411       }
00412 */      
00413         printf("-------xxxxxxxxxxx\n");
00414 
00415       /* here begins the normal iterative algorithm */
00416 
00417       mat_mult(s,vn,t1);
00418       mat_add(eye,t1,t1);
00419       if (!my_inv_ludcmp(t1, n_states, t1)) {
00420         
00421         printf("special matrix >s  vn< for Hewer interation is singular\n");
00422         return FALSE;
00423         
00424       } 
00425 
00426       mat_mult(t1,fx,phi);
00427 
00428       mat_trans(phi,t4);
00429       mat_mult(t4,vn,t1);
00430       mat_mult(t1,s,t1);
00431       mat_mult(t1,vn,t1);
00432       mat_mult(t1,phi,t1);
00433 
00434       mat_add(t1,lxx,t1);
00435 
00436       mat_mult(t4,vn,t4);
00437       mat_mult(t4,phi,t4);
00438 
00439       mat_equal(vn, p);  /* temp store old vn */
00440       mat_add(t1,t4,vn);
00441       mat_sub(p, vn, diff);
00442 
00443       difference = 0;
00444       for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00445         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00446           difference += fabs(diff[i][j]);
00447         }
00448       }
00449       
00450       /* now check the result of this show */
00451       
00452       if (difference < EPSILON) {
00453         
00454         /* this calculates the k-matrix */
00455         
00456         mat_mult(fut, vn, t2);
00457         mat_mult(t2, fu, v);
00458         mat_add(v, luu, v);
00459         
00460         if (!my_inv_ludcmp(v, n_controls, v)) {
00461           
00462           printf("matrix to calculate k >r+b's b< for Hewer is singular\n");
00463           return FALSE;
00464           
00465         }       
00466         mat_mult(v, fut, t2);
00467         mat_mult(t2, vn, t2);
00468         mat_mult(t2, fx, d);
00469         
00470 
00471         rc = TRUE;
00472         
00473       } else {
00474         
00475         rc = FALSE;
00476         
00477       }
00478       
00479 /*      
00480       printf("return code=%d difference=%f\n",rc,difference);
00481       for (i=1; i<=n_states; ++i) {
00482         for (j=1; j<=n_states; ++j) {
00483           printf("%f ",d[i][j]);
00484         }
00485         printf("\n");
00486       }
00487 */      
00488 
00489       break;
00490 
00491 
00492 
00493     case EIGEN_METHOD:
00494 
00495       /* this methods uses the discrete Ricatti equation to generate the solution; 
00496          it does not need iterations to find this solution; see Matlab */       
00497       
00498       /* step one: some inverse are needed */
00499       
00500       if (!my_inv_ludcmp(fx, n_states, fx_invt)) {
00501         
00502         printf("state matrix fu is singular\n");
00503         return FALSE;
00504         
00505       }
00506       
00507       mat_trans(fx_invt, fx_invt);
00508       
00509       if (!my_inv_ludcmp(luu, n_states, luu_inv)) {
00510         
00511         printf("weight matrix luu is singular\n");
00512         return FALSE;
00513         
00514       }
00515       
00516       /* build the Hamiltonian matrix; note: this is a bigger matrix and I will
00517          fool around with the matrix pointers to place the necessary submatrices
00518          in this matrix */
00519       
00520       mat_equal(fu,h);
00521       mat_mult(h,luu_inv,h);
00522       mat_mult(h,fut,h);
00523       mat_mult(h,fx_invt,h);
00524       
00525       for (i=1;i<=n_states;++i) for (j=1;j<=n_states;++j) h[i][j+n_states] = -h[i][j];
00526       
00527       mat_mult(h,lxx,h);
00528       mat_add(h,fx,h);
00529       
00530       mat_mult(fxt,lxx,t1);
00531       for (i=1;i<=n_states;++i) for(j=1;j<=n_states;++j) h[i+n_states][j] = -t1[i][j];
00532       
00533       for (i=1;i<=n_states;++i) for (j=1;j<=n_states;++j) 
00534         h[i+n_states][j+n_states] = fx_invt[i][j];
00535       
00536       
00537       /* now I need the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of this Hamiltonian */
00538       
00539       
00540       
00541         /************* not really implemented yet *****************/
00542 
00543 
00544       break;
00545 
00546 
00547     default:
00548 
00549       printf("wrong dlqr method\n hit continue to exit ....\n");
00550       getchar();
00551       exit(-1);
00552 
00553       break;
00554 
00555     }
00556 
00557   }
00558   
00559   if (count >= LIMIT) printf("DLWR choked because of LIMIT\n");
00560   
00561   return rc;
00562 
00563 }
